content:
Sure, here's a high-level site map for a Pinterest-like application:

1. Homepage:
	* Search bar
	* Featured content
	* User boards/pins
	* Categories/topics
	* Footer (about, help, terms of service, etc.)
2. Sign up/Login:
	* Form for new users to sign up
	* Link to log in for existing users
3. Profile:
	* User information (profile picture, name, bio, website)
	* User boards
	* User activity (pins, likes, comments)
	* Follow/unfollow button
4. Boards:
	* List of boards
	* Board cover image
	* Board title and description
	* Number of pins in the board
	* Edit/delete board button
5. Pins:
	* Pinned image
	* Pin description
	* Board it's saved to
	* User who pinned it
	* Like/save button
	* Comments
6. Search:
	* Search bar
	* Results (pins, boards, users)
7. Categories:
	* List of categories/topics
	* Featured content for each category
8. Notifications:
	* List of recent activity (new followers, new pins on boards, etc.)
9. Settings:
	* Account information (email, password, etc.)
	* Privacy settings
	* Notifications settings
	* Log out button.
